title: Dallas' WFAA-TV poaches another Houston on-air face: Sonia Azad
text:
Image 1 of / 12 12 Houston TV faces who left in 2015
Sonia Azad joined KTRK-TV in June 2009. In March 2015, she told her Facebook fans she was leaving the station after 6 years to "start a new chapter." Several months later, WFAA-TV announced she was going to be their new medical reporter.
Keep clicking to see who left.
Houston TV faces who left in 2015
Sonia Azad joined KTRK-TV in June... Image 2 of 12 Hilary Whittier
Whitter joined KRIV-TV in February 2014 as a multimedia journalist, but she only stayed on for a year and a half. She's now a communications specialist for Commercial Real Estate Services in New York City, N.Y. Her last message to her Houston audience was that she "simply missed NYC."
Photo: Hilary Whittier, Houston Chronicle Hilary Whittier
Whitter joined KRIV-TV in February 2014 as a... Image 3 of 12 Maria Corrales
Previously a reporter for Houston's KXLN-TV, Corrales joined KRIV-TV in February 2014 as a multimedia journalist. Sometime in April 2015, she was let go from the station. In June, she revealed her new gig as the public information officer for the Harris County Precinct 6 Constable's Office.
Photo: KRIV Fox 26 Houston Maria Corrales
Previously a reporter for Houston's KXLN-TV, Corrales... Image 4 of 12 Malini Basu
Basu joined KHOU-TV as a general assignments reporter in February 2012. Three years later, she jumped ship for Boston's WFXT-TV as a reporter.
Photo: WFXT-TV, Fox Television Stations Malini Basu
Basu joined KHOU-TV as a general assignments reporter in... Image 5 of 12 Andrew Horansky
Horansky joined KHOU-TV in April 2012 as a general assignments reporter. In February 2015, he returned to his hometown of Cleveland, Ohio to report for WKYC-TV and rejoin his family.
Photo: Andrew Horansky Andrew Horansky
Horansky joined KHOU-TV in April 2012 as a general... Image 6 of 12 Karla Barguiarena
Barguiarena joined KTRK-TV as a reporter in February 2014. Attentive Houston TV watchers may remember she was a reporter for KHOU several years ago. In June 2015, she announced she was leaving ABC 13 to rejoin her husband in New England.
Photo: ABC 13 Eyewitness News Karla Barguiarena
Barguiarena joined KTRK-TV as a reporter in... Image 7 of 12 Sharron Melton
Melton joined KTRK-TV in 2007 as a morning anchor. In May 2015, a year after the station seemingly demoted her to a reporter position, she announced her departure on Facebook.
Photo: Roswitha Vogler, Photography By Roswitha Vogler. Sharron Melton
Melton joined KTRK-TV in 2007 as a morning anchor. In... Image 8 of 12 Don Nelson
Nelson joined KRIV-TV in November 1975. After nearly 40 years of reporting traffic and other features for the station, he finally retired in February 2015.
Photo: Mayra Beltran, Staff Don Nelson
Nelson joined KRIV-TV in November 1975. After nearly 40... Image 9 of 12 Caitlin Espinosa
Espinosa joined KRIV-TV in October 2012. In mid-January 2015, she announced she would be leaving the station, citing health issues and a new YouTube venture called #DearCaitlin. Last check on her LinkedIn page shows she's a substitute teacher at Logos Preparatory Academy in Sugar Land, Texas.
Caitlin Espinosa
Espinosa joined KRIV-TV in October 2012. In... Image 10 of 12 Anthony Yanez
Yanez joined KPRC-TV in July 2003 as a morning meteorologist. In January 2015, eleven years later, Yanez announced he would be leaving Houston for the sunny shores of California at Los Angeles' KNBC-TV.
Photo: Dave Rossman Anthony Yanez
Yanez joined KPRC-TV in July 2003 as a morning... Image 11 of 12 Kristine Galvan
Galvan joined KRIV-TV in 2005 as a general assignments reporter. In June 2015, she announced her departure from Fox 26 and TV news in general, citing trouble with her knee after surgery and the changing state of the industry.
Kristine Galvan
Galvan joined KRIV-TV in 2005 as a general... Image 12 of 12 Dallas' WFAA-TV poaches another Houston on-air face: Sonia Azad 1 / 12 Back to Gallery When Sonia Azad left KTRK-TV earlier this year, some wondered where the award-winning reporter would land next.
Dallas' WFAA-TV's human resources department said Azad would be joining them as a medical reporter, starting Monday. She'll be replacing Janet St. James who was with the station for nearly two decades.
And this isn't the first time the TEGNA-operated station has poached Houston's on-air talent:
In May 2014, Demond Fernandez left the ABC station after three years to become a senior reporter in Dallas. Wendy Corona joined the station after her messy break-up with KPRC-TV. The station's news director, Carolyn Mungo, was a former KHOU-TV reporter and assistant news director with KRIV-TV before she made the move to Dallas.
